Title: Valiant Arsenal shock Barca to win women’s Champions League
Summary: Arsenal produced a shock 1-0 victory over Barcelona to win the women's Champions League on Saturday in Lisbon . Stina Blackstenius' goal secured the win for Arsenal .

Title: Adebayo denies rift in SDP, says party running peacefully
Summary: Prince Adewole Adebayo denies rift in SDP, says party running peacefully . Adebayso is the party’s presidential candidate in the 2023 elections . National Publicity Secretary of the party, Araba Araba, said the party is running normally and peacefully .

Title: Leganes relegated from La Liga as Espanyol survive
Summary: Leganes relegated from La Liga despite a 3-0 win over Valladolid . Espanyol beat Las Palmas 2-0 to survive, in their final league matches . Javi Hernandez, Yan Diomande and Juan Cruz all scored at Butarque .

Title: FG condemns video of students writing WAEC with torchlights at night
Summary: Federal Ministry of Education condemns video of students writing WAEC with torchlights . Minister of State for Education, Dr Tunji Alausa, expressed his displeasure in a statement issued .

Title: UTME: Zulum awards scholarship to female Borno indigenes with 250, above
Summary: Gov. Babagana Zulum of Borno has announced a full scholarship for all female indigenes of the state who scored 250 and above in the 2025 Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination .

Title: DELTA:How APC saw Gov Oborevwori before and after defection
Summary: Governor Sheriff Oborevwori defected from PDP to All Progressives Congress (APC) last month . The governor, his former party, PDP, and the APC never saw anything good and reassuring in his almost two years in office .

Title: Cardoso pushes Nigeria up global remittances ladder
Summary: The launch of the Non-Resident Bank Verification Number platform was motivated by the determination of the Governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria, Mr. Olayemi Cardoso, to change the narrative of Diaspora Nigerians’ remittances .

Title: Trump, Malema, Ramaphosa and the Oval Office grill
Summary: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa met with American President Donald J. Trump to discuss bilateral issues and world affairs . It began with Trump’s unsubstantiated and frankly asinine allegation that the white Boers of South Africa are racist .

Title: No automatic ticket for House of Assembly members in APC — Ayiri
Summary: Ayiri Emami said the party intends to have an open primary for House of Assembly, chairmanship and councillorship positions . Ayiri, who spoke at Prince Francis Agbowosile residence in Warri, Delta State, reaffirmed his support .

Title: BIAFRA: Nigeria still treats Ndigbo as vassals — Igbo leaders
Summary: Igbo leaders have said that structural injustice and marginalisation that led to the end of the Nigerian civil war remain entrenched in Nigeria’s political architecture . Publicity Secretary of Ohanaeze Ndigbo Worldwide, Dr. Ezechi Chukwu, and Methodist Archbishop Archbishop .

Title: Why Nigerian men push back on family planning
Summary: In Nigeria, family planning is often considered a woman’s responsibility, and this gendered perception continues to shape reproductive health decisions across the country . Despite efforts by health organisations, the uptake of family planning remains relatively low, particularly among married women in Northern Nigeria . Experts say this slow progress can be largely attributed to male opposition to family

Title: People of Ijesaland should look forward to transformational leadership under Owa Adesuyi Haastrup  -Olori Omolara
Summary: Olori Omolara Oluwatoyin Haastrup is the wife of the Ijesaland monarch . She describes her husband as a man set apart by lineage and character .

Title: Auxiliary nurses run private hospitals as owners ignore professionals
Summary: Private hospitals are turning to auxiliary nurses as a cheaper alternative to registered nurses . PUNCH Healthwise investigation reveals how the activities of these quacks have led to medical errors, avoidable deaths, and a lack of confidence in the sector .

Title: UTME: Students need support not blame, psychologists tell parents
Summary: Seasoned mental health professionals have stated that students affected by the glitches and mass failure in the 2025 Unified Tertiary Matriculation Examination need counselling support and reassurance, not blame . They warned that without timely psychological intervention, some candidates could spiral into depression or suicidal ideation, as witnessed in a recent tragic case involving a teenage girl

Title: Coalition: LP chieftain seeks  Atiku-Obi power-sharing deal
Summary: A former House of Representatives candidate for Ijesa South Federal Constituency in Osun State, Gideon Aloba, has called for a genuine power-sharing arrangement between Atiku Abubakar and Peter Obi ahead of the 2027 presidential election . Aloba said only a united front between the opposition leaders could unseat President B
